article:
A 'film splicer' (also called a 'film joiner', usually in Europe) is a device
which can be used to physically join together lengths of photographic film. It
is mostly used in film motion pictures. The units are made in various types
depending on the usage: Single-8, Super 8 film, 16mm, 35mm and 70mm. Used in
film editing to make a cut (transition). [http://www.city-
net.com/~fodder/edit/art1.html City Net, The Art for Film
Splicing] [http://www.nfsa.gov.au/preservation/glossary/splicers The
National Film and Sound Archive of Australia, film splicers, cement and
tape]
